com.github.dm.jrt.core.util

Class UnitDuration

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.dm.jrt.core.util.UnitTime
      • com.github.dm.jrt.core.util.UnitDuration
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Comparable<UnitTime>

    public class UnitDuration
extends UnitTime
    Utility class for handling a time duration in different time units.

    Created by davide-maestroni on 09/09/2014.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  UnitDuration.Condition
      Interface defining a condition to check.

      • days

        @NotNull
public static UnitDuration days(double days)
        Creates and returns an object representing the specified number of days.
        The returned time will have at maximum the same precision as the next more granular time unit.
        Parameters:
        days - the number of days.
        Returns:
        the time instance.

      • sleepAtLeast

        public static void sleepAtLeast(long time,
                                @NotNull
                                TimeUnit unit)
                         throws InterruptedException
        Performs a Thread.sleep(long, int) using the specified duration as timeout, ensuring that the sleep time is respected even if spurious wake-ups happen in the while.
        Parameters:
        time - the time value.
        unit - the time unit.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - if the current thread is interrupted.

      • sleepSinceMillis

        public static boolean sleepSinceMillis(long time,
                                       @NotNull
                                       TimeUnit unit,
                                       long milliTime)
                                throws InterruptedException
        Performs a Thread.sleep(long, int) as if started from the specified system time in milliseconds, by using the specified time as timeout.
        Parameters:
        time - the time value.
        unit - the time unit.
        milliTime - the starting system time in milliseconds.
        Returns:
        whether the sleep happened at all.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if this duration overflows the maximum sleep time.
        InterruptedException - if the current thread is interrupted.
        See Also:
        System.currentTimeMillis()

      • sleepSinceNanos

        public static boolean sleepSinceNanos(long time,
                                      @NotNull
                                      TimeUnit unit,
                                      long nanoTime)
                               throws InterruptedException
        Performs a Thread.sleep(long, int) as if started from the specified high precision system time in nanoseconds, by using the specified time as timeout.
        Parameters:
        time - the time value.
        unit - the time unit.
        nanoTime - the starting system time in nanoseconds.
        Returns:
        whether the sleep happened at all.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if this duration overflows the maximum sleep time.
        InterruptedException - if the current thread is interrupted.
        See Also:
        System.nanoTime()

      • timeSinceMillis

        @NotNull
public static UnitDuration timeSinceMillis(long milliTime)
        Creates and returns an object representing the time range between now and a time in the past.
        If the specified is in the future, a zero() duration will be returned.
        Parameters:
        milliTime - the system time in milliseconds.
        Returns:
        the time duration instance.
        See Also:
        System.currentTimeMillis()

      • wait

        public static void wait(long time,
                        @NotNull
                        TimeUnit unit,
                        @NotNull
                        Object target)
                 throws InterruptedException
        Performs an Object.wait() using the specified time.
        If the specified time is negative, the method will wait indefinitely.
        Parameters:
        time - the time value.
        unit - the time unit.
        target - the target object.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - if the current thread is interrupted.

      • waitSinceMillis

        public static boolean waitSinceMillis(long time,
                                      @NotNull
                                      TimeUnit unit,
                                      @NotNull
                                      Object target,
                                      long milliTime)
                               throws InterruptedException
        Performs an Object.wait() as if started from the specified system time in milliseconds, by using the specified time.
        If the specified time is negative, the method will wait indefinitely.
        Parameters:
        time - the time value.
        unit - the time unit.
        target - the target object.
        milliTime - the starting system time in milliseconds.
        Returns:
        whether the wait happened at all.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - if the current thread is interrupted.
        See Also:
        System.currentTimeMillis()

      • waitSinceNanos

        public static boolean waitSinceNanos(long time,
                                     @NotNull
                                     TimeUnit unit,
                                     @NotNull
                                     Object target,
                                     long nanoTime)
                              throws InterruptedException
        Performs an Object.wait() as if started from the specified high precision system time in nanoseconds, by using the specified time.
        If the specified time is negative, the method will wait indefinitely.
        Parameters:
        time - the time value.
        unit - the time unit.
        target - the target object.
        nanoTime - the starting system time in nanoseconds.
        Returns:
        whether the wait happened at all.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - if the current thread is interrupted.
        See Also:
        System.nanoTime()

      • waitTrue

        public static boolean waitTrue(long time,
                               @NotNull
                               TimeUnit unit,
                               @NotNull
                               Object target,
                               @NotNull
                               UnitDuration.Condition condition)
                        throws InterruptedException
        Waits for the specified condition to be true by performing an Object.wait() and using the specified time.
        If the specified time is negative, the method will wait indefinitely.
        Parameters:
        time - the time value.
        unit - the time unit.
        target - the target object.
        condition - the condition to verify.
        Returns:
        whether the check became true before the timeout elapsed.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - if the current thread is interrupted.

      • minus

        @NotNull
public UnitDuration minus(@NotNull
                                   UnitTime time)
        Returns a new instance whose time value is decremented by the specified one.

        Note that the unit of the returned time will match the one with the highest precision.

        Overrides:
        minus in class UnitTime
        Parameters:
        time - the time to subtract.
        Returns:
        the time duration instance.

      • sleepAtLeast

        public void sleepAtLeast()
                  throws InterruptedException
        Performs a Thread.sleep(long, int) using this duration as timeout, ensuring that the sleep time is respected even if spurious wake-ups happen in the while.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - if the current thread is interrupted.

      • sleepSinceMillis

        public boolean sleepSinceMillis(long milliTime)
                         throws InterruptedException
        Performs a Thread.sleep(long, int) as if started from the specified system time in milliseconds, by using this duration as timeout.
        Parameters:
        milliTime - the starting system time in milliseconds.
        Returns:
        whether the sleep happened at all.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if this duration overflows the maximum sleep time.
        InterruptedException - if the current thread is interrupted.
        See Also:
        System.currentTimeMillis()

      • sleepSinceNanos

        public boolean sleepSinceNanos(long nanoTime)
                        throws InterruptedException
        Performs a Thread.sleep(long, int) as if started from the specified high precision system time in nanoseconds, by using this duration as timeout.
        Parameters:
        nanoTime - the starting system time in nanoseconds.
        Returns:
        whether the sleep happened at all.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if this duration overflows the maximum sleep time.
        InterruptedException - if the current thread is interrupted.
        See Also:
        System.nanoTime()
